revision.text:
A '''multimedia franchise''' is a [[media franchise]] for which installments exist in multiple forms of [[Media (communication)|media]], such as [[book]]s, [[comic book]]s, [[films]], [[television series]], and [[video game]]s. Multimedia franchises usually develop due to the popularization of an original creative work, and then its expansion to other media through [[licensing agreement]]s, with respect to [[intellectual property]] in the franchise's characters and settings,See, e.g., Barry Langford, ''Post-classical Hollywood: Film Industry, Style and Ideology Since 1945'', p. 207, {{ISBN|074863858X}}: "For the studios, a home-run is a film from which a multimedia 'franchise' can be generated; the colossally expensive creation of cross-media conglomerates predicated on synergistic rewards provides an obvious imperative to develop such products". although the trend later developed wherein franchises would be launched in multiple forms of media simultaneously.Harry J. Brown, ''Videogames and Education'' (2008), p. 41, {{ISBN|0765629496}}: {{quote|In one of the most celebrated ventures in media convergence, Larry and Andy Wachowski, creators of ''The Matrix'' trilogy, produced the game ''Enter the Matrix'' (2003) simultaneously with the last two films of the trilogy, shooting scenes for the game on the movie's sets with the movie s actors, and releasing the game on the same day as ''The Matrix: Reloaded''. Likewise, on September 21, 2004, Lucasfilm jointly released a new DVD box set of the original ''Star Wars'' trilogy with ''Star Wars: Battlefront'', a combat game in which players can reenact battles from all six ''Star Wars'' films. In 2005, Peter Jackson likewise produced his blockbuster film ''King Kong'' (2005) in tandem with a successful ''King Kong'' game designed by Michael Ancel and published by Ubisoft. In the last several years, numerous licensed videogame adaptations of major summer and holiday blockbusters were released a few days before or a few days after their respective films, including: all three ''Star Wars'' films (1999–2005); all five ''Harry Potter'' films (2001–2008); all three ''Spider-Man'' films (2002–2007); ''Hulk'' (2002); ''The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers'' (2002); ''The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King'' (2003); ''The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe'' (2005); ''Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest'' (2006); ''Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End'' (2007); and ''Transformers'' (2007). These multimedia franchises have made it more difficult to distinguish the production of films and videogames as separate enterprises.}} In order to qualify for this list, a franchise must have works in at least '''three''' forms of media, and must have two or more separate works in at least '''two''' of those forms of media (a television series or comic book series is considered a single work for purposes of this list; multiple spin-off series or [[Reboot (fiction)|reboots]] of a previously ended series are considered multiple works). For example, a television series that spawned one film and one novelization would not qualify; a television series that had a spin-off series, or was remade as a new series, and which spawned two films and one novelization does qualify. This list does not include [[List of public domain works with multimedia adaptations|public domain works from which adaptations have been made in multiple media]], but which do not involve licensing or other means by which an author or owner controls the franchise. A franchise may be included if it obtained multimedia franchise status prior to works within the collection entering the public domain. Note: In the following table, the initial media through which the franchise characters or settings became known is shown in boldface. Only works of fiction are only considered part of the series; a book or a documentary film ''about'' the franchise is not itself an installment in the franchise. ==Franchises originating in literary works== These franchises began as novels, short stories, and other forms of purely literary works. {| class="wikitable sortable" border="1" ! style="width:10%;"| '''Franchise'''

page.title: List of works by Fanny Crosby

revision.text:
This is a selected '''list of works of [[Fanny Crosby]]'''. ==Autobiographies== * [Carleton, Will]. ''Fanny Crosby's Life-Story''. New York, NY: Every Where Publishing Company, 1903.http://cdigital.dgb.uanl.mx/la/1020023869/1020023869_001.pdf * [Carleton, Will]. ''Fanny Crosby's Life-Work''. New York, NY: Every Where Publishing Company, 1905. * ''Memories of Eighty Years''. Boston, MA: James H. Earle & Company, 1906.[http://www.disabilitymuseum.org/lib/docs/1653.htm?page=print disability history museum-Memories Of Eighty Years] * Keller, Cozette; Fanny Crosby, and William Howard Doane. ''Safe in the Arms of Jesus: Illustrated Pantomimed Hymn''. Edgar S. Werner, 1917. * ''This is My Story, This Is My Song'', 1906. {{ISBN|978-1-898787-41-9}}.






==Books of poetry== * ''The Blind Girl''. Wiley & Putnam, 1844.[https://books.google.com/books?id=RRcTAAAAIAAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=%22Fanny+Crosby%22&hl=en&ei=bZCGTauqNoncvQOZp8TMCA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CDsQ6AEwAw#v=onepage&q&f=false The blind girl: and other poems - Google Books] * ''Monterey and Other Poems''. R. Craighead, 1851.[https://books.google.com/books?id=ThcTAAAAIAAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=%22Fanny+Crosby%22&hl=en&ei=C_iGTbHwN4nCcbzJ1aUD&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CEQQ6AEwBA# Monterey, and other poems - Google Books] * ''A Wreath of Columbia’s Flowers''. H. Dayton, 1858.[https://books.google.com/books?id=9fcBAAAAYAAJ&printsec=frontcover&dq=%22Fanny+Crosby%22&hl=en&ei=C_iGTbHwN4nCcbzJ1aUD&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=7&ved=0CE8Q6AEwBg#v=onepage&q&f=false A wreath of Columbia's flowers: 1858 - Google Books] * ''Bells at Evening and Other Verses; with Biographical Sketch by Robert Lowry''. New York, NY: Biglow & Main, 1897; 3rd ed., New York, NY and Chicago, IL: Biglow & Main,1899.[https://archive.org/stream/bellsateveningot00crosiala#page/n5/mode/2up Bells at evening and other verses] ==Cantatas== * -------- and George Frederick Root. ''The Flower Queen: A Tonic Sol-fa Cantata''. Advertiser and Chronicle Offices, 1880. * -------- and George Frederick Root. ''Libretto of The Flower Queen; or the Coronation of the Rose''. New York: Mason Brothers, 1853. * -------- and Hart Pease Danks. ''Conquered by Kindness: A Juvenile Operetta''. New York, NY: Wm. A. Pond, 1881.Amelia Howe Kritzer, ed., ''Plays by Early American Women, 1775-1850'' (University of Michigan Press, 1995):381. * -------- and Hart Pease Danks. ''Zanie: An Operetta''. Cincinnati: John Church Co., 1887.{{Cite book|url=https://archive.org/details/zanieoperetta00dank|title=Zanie : an operetta|last=Danks|first=H. P. (Hart Pease)|last2=Crosby|first2=Fanny|date=1887|publisher=Cincinnati : J. Church Co.|others=University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill Music Library}} * -------- and Theodore E. Perkins. "The Excursion". In ''The Mount Zion Collection of Sacred and Secular Music: Consisting of Tunes, Anthems, Singing School Exercises and Songs for the Sabbath School and Social Circle''. Edited by Theodore E. Perkins. New York, NY: A.S. Barnes & Co., 1869. * -------- and William Howard Doane. ''Santa Claus' Home; or, The Christmas Excursion: A Christmas Cantata for the Sunday School and Choir''. Biglow & Main, 1886. * -------- ; George Frederick Root; Chauncy M. Cady; and William Batchelder Bradbury. ''DANIEL: or the Captivity and Restoration. A Sacred Cantata in Three Parts, Words selected and prepared by C[hauncy]. M[arvin]. Cady, Esq., [1824-1889], assisted by Miss F[rances]. J[ane]. Crosby. [Mrs. Van Alstyne] [1820-1915]. Music composed by Geo[rge]. F[rederick]. Root [1820-1895] and W[illiam]. B[atchelder]. Bradbury [1816-1868],'' http://www.pdmusic.org/root-gf/gfr53-c02.txt * -------- ; George Frederick Root; and Henry Fisher. ''The New Flower Queen: or, The Coronation of the Rose. A Cantata in Two Parts, for the Use of Singing Classes in Academies, Ladies' Schools, and High Schools''. Oliver Ditson co., 1870. ==Popular songs== *''Fare Thee Well Kitty Dear''--1852http://www.pdmusic.org/root-gf/gfr52a.txt *''Mother, Sweet Mother Why Linger Away''--(New York, NY: William Hall & Son, 1852)[http://memory.loc.gov/cgi-bin/ampage?collId=mussm&fileName=sm2/sm1852/692000/692190/mussm692190.db&recNum=0&itemLink=D?mussm:3:./temp/~ammem_c0nz::&linkText=0 Music for the Nation: American Sheet Music] *''Bird of the North''--(Feb. 1852)http://www.pdmusic.org/root-gf/gfr52botn.txt *''The Hazel Dell''--(1853) [http://www.pdmusic.org/root-gf/gfr53b.txt] or Crosby & Lowry (1899), pp. 130-131. *''There's Music in the Air''-- (1857) [http://www.pdmusic.org/root-gf/gfr57b.txt] ==Selected hymns== * "[[All the Way My Savior Leads Me]]"--1875, music by [[Robert Lowry (hymn writer)|Robert Lowry]]"All the Way My Savior Leads Me", in Robert Lowry and W. Howard Doane, ''Brightest and Best'' (New York: Biglow & Main, 1875), #65; "All the Way My Savior Leads Me", http://hymntime.com/tch/htm/a/l/t/altheway.htm * "[[Blessed Assurance]]"--1873, music by [[Phoebe Knapp]]"Blessed Assurance", http://hymntime.com/tch/htm/b/l/e/blesseda.htm * "The Bright Forever"--1871, music by Hubert P. The '''Name Service Switch''' ('''NSS''') is a facility in [[Unix-like]] [[operating system]]s that provides a variety of sources for common configuration databases and name resolution mechanisms. These sources include local operating system files (such as [[/etc/passwd]], /etc/group, and [[/etc/hosts]]), the [[Domain Name System]] (DNS), the [[Network Information Service]] (NIS), and [[LDAP]]. =={{visible anchor|nsswitch.conf}}== A [[system administrator]] usually configures the operating system's name services using the file /etc/nsswitch.conf. This lists databases (such as [[/etc/passwd|passwd]], [[Shadow password|shadow]] and [[Group (database)|group]]) and one or more sources for obtaining that information. Examples for sources are ''files'' for local files, ''ldap'' for the [[Lightweight Directory Access Protocol]], ''nis'' for the [[Network Information Service]], ''nisplus'' for [[Nisplus|NIS+]], and ''wins'' for [[Windows Internet Name Service]]. The nsswitch.conf file has line entries for each service consisting of a database name in the first field, terminated by a colon, and a list of possible source databases mechanisms in the second field. A typical file might look like: 
passwd:     files ldap
shadow:     files
group:      files ldap

hosts:      dns nis files

ethers:     files nis
netmasks:   files nis
networks:   files nis
protocols:  files nis
rpc:        files nis
services:   files nis

automount:  files
aliases:    files
The order of the services listed determines in which order NSS will attempt to use those services to resolve queries on the specified database. ==History== Earlier [[Unix-like]] systems, with the notable exception of [[Ultrix]], either accessed only the configuration files or had hard-coded rules for files or databases to access; Ultrix offered nearly identical functionality to the Name Service Switch, using the configuration file /etc/svc.conf. [[Sun Microsystems]] first developed NSS for their [[Solaris (operating system)|Solaris]] operating system, but subsequently programmers ported it to many other operating systems including [[FreeBSD]], [[NetBSD]], [[Linux]], [[HP-UX]], [[IRIX]] and [[AIX operating system|AIX]]. == See also == * [[BSD Authentication]] * [[Group (database)]] * [[Name server]] * [[Passwd (database)]] * [[Pluggable Authentication Modules]] ==External links== * {{man|5|nsswitch.conf|NetBSD|name-service switch configuration file}} * [https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Name-Service-Switch.html Name Service Switch implementation in the GNU C Library] * [http://www.padl.com/OSS/nss_ldap.html NSS module supporting LDAP]: nss_ldap * [http://arthurdejong.org/nss-ldapd/ Another NSS module supporting LDAP]: nss-ldapd * [http://megacz.com/software/libnss-afs.html NSS module supporting AFS]: nss_afs [[Category:Unix]] [[Category:Domain name system]] [[Category:Directory services]]

revision.comment: The term 'unsuccessful' is made redundant by the term 'attempt', and also implies that a completed suicide is a success/positive
revision.text:
{{More footnotes|date=February 2011}} [[File:The Pabst Plan Warsaw 1.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Map of the plan.]] The '''Pabst Plan''' ({{lang-de|Neue deutsche Stadt Warschau}}, "New German city of Warsaw") was a [[Nazi Germany|Nazi German]] [[urban planning|urban plan]] to reconstruct the city of [[Warsaw]] as a [[Nazi architecture|Nazi model city]]. Named after its creator Friedrich Pabst,<ref>[[:pl:Friedrich Pabst]]</ref> the Nazis' "Chief Architect for Warsaw", the plan assumed that Warsaw, the historical capital of [[Poland]] and a city of 1.5 million inhabitants, would be completely destroyed and rebuilt as a small German town of not more than 130,000 inhabitants.
In modern historical works the term is used to denote any of the German [[World War II]] plans concerning the destruction and reconstruction of Warsaw. In particular the "Pabst Plan" refers to a plan prepared by Hubert Gross and Otto Nurnberger in 1940 and another plan, prepared by Pabst himself in 1942. Both plans envisioned the destruction of most of Warsaw with its historical monuments and residential areas. In its place a new model city was to be created as a seat for the German ruling class of the [[Occupation of Poland (1939-1945)|occupied Polish territories]]. It was to house a large ''Parteivolkshalle'' ("People's Party Hall") in place of the [[Royal Castle in Warsaw]] and serve as a major transportation hub.
After the [[Warsaw Uprising (1944)|1944 Warsaw Uprising]], the Germans decided to [[Planned destruction of Warsaw|destroy the city in its entirety]].
==History==
===Pre-war planning=== The destruction of the city was already planned long before [[Planned destruction of Warsaw|its almost total destruction in 1944]], even prior to the start of [[World War II]]. On 20 June 1939, while [[Adolf Hitler]] was visiting an architectural bureau in [[Würzburg]], his attention was captured by a project to create a future "German" town – Warsaw ({{lang-de|Warschau}}, {{lang-pl|Warszawa}}),{{Citation needed|date=May 2013}} which later became known as the Pabst Plan. Friedrich Pabst prepared a technical plan for the annihilation of Warsaw and the complete ethnic cleansing of its native Polish population, with Polish Jews condemned to be the first destined for extermination. It envisaged the transformation of the Polish capital into a new, provincial German town, containing an exclusively [[Germans|ethnic German]] population of no more than 130,000 people on the left bank supported by a slave labour camp of 80,000 Poles on the right bank of the Vistula. Warsaw’s total population in 1935 was around 1.3 million, consisting of [[Poles]], [[Jews]] and other minorities, which meant that putting the new urbanization plan to work would require the complete removal of its entire population. The project included 15 separate plans and photos, and solid pre-build documentation. Among all the pages of the project the most important is a colored plan of the future town which was created by German architects in 1:20 000 scale titled: ''Die neue deutsche Stadt Warschau'' (Warsaw, the New German City). The final table bore the caption ''Der Abbau der Polenstadt und der Aufbau der Deutschen Stadt'' (The Destruction of the Polish City and the Construction of the German City).
Some parts of the project that were showing Warsaw’s urban development from the half of 17th century until the year 1935 were based on Polish documentation from 1935 and presumably on scientific sources prepared for ''Warsaw’s Territorial Development of Communication and Transportation'' by Prof. O. Sosnowski. All these sources were skillfully extracted long before the war. At an early stage, thanks to German deception based on the false pretense of doing scientific research, the German planners concealed the hidden agenda necessary for creating such a plan. German scholars, historians, conservators and professors of architecture and other experts were enlisted to catalogue all of the most important and culturally significant landmarks of the city, the most exquisite churches and public buildings, key library collections, artworks and sculptures.
The "German Varsavia" was planned to be a built on the crossroad of German [[Autobahn|highways]] and [[Breitspurbahn|railroad networks]]. It covered a 6 km² built-up area plus 1 km² of the centuries-old Warsaw’s Prague district, for a combined 7 km² area, with parks and green areas bringing to a total of 15 km². The 7 km² of buildings was just 1/20 of the existing Polish capital city and was very different from the actual existing road network of 1939. The whole town center was to be built into a net of narrow, picturesque streets, resembling the planning of a typical German town. The modern and wide Polish capital avenues (like Ulica Marszałkowska, Twarda, Mokotowska, Dzika, Oś Saska, Oś Stanisławowska) would have been erased forever with all their monumental and beautiful buildings and palaces. Only the remains of the [[Warsaw Old Town|Old Town district]] (without the [[Royal Castle (Warsaw)|Polish King’s Castle]]), the [[Łazienki Palace|King’s Baths Palace]] ({{lang-pl|Łazienki Królewskie}}) and [[Belweder|Belvedere]] ({{lang-pl|Belweder}}), and modified parts of the Vistula riverside buildings would have been saved.
===Wartime implementation of the plan=== {{multiple image|align=right|direction=vertical|width=175 |image1=Bundesarchiv N 1576 Bild-003, Warschau, Bettelnde Kinder.jpg |caption1=Ghetto children <!-- Commented out: |image2=Childwarsawghetto.jpg --> |caption2=A child dying in the streets of the [[Warsaw Ghetto]] September 19, 1941 }}
After the start of military operations and the [[Siege of Warsaw (1939)|fall of the capital]] into German hands the project was updated, incorporating the city's partial destruction in the September offensive of 1939. The project was soon to be included as a part of the overall [[Germanization]] plan of the East, the genocidal [[Generalplan Ost]].
On October 8, 1939 [[Polish areas annexed by Nazi Germany|western areas of Poland were annexed]] by the Third Reich, and on October 12, 1939 the central areas of Poland were incorporated into the [[General Government]] by Hitler’s decrees. The capital of the Gubernia was placed in [[Kraków]] (Krakau, Cracow) for security reasons. The occupying German elite was afraid of unsubdued Warsaw.
The plan was to be implemented in several stages. One of the parts for the plan, the "Demolition of the Polish City and the Construction of the German City" (''Abbau der Polen-Stadt und der Aufbau der Deutschen Stadt'') included a list of the Polish capital’s centers of life destined for destruction, put in chronological order based on planned liquidation date. The planners also decided to use the destruction caused by bombings and fires during the September 1939 seizure of the city as a pretext for the urbanistic changes. Another part of the plan included a detailed map of the anticipated destruction showing almost all buildings destroyed coincidentally according to the original plan. In reality only 10 percent of the buildings were destroyed in 1939, with total civilian and military losses of around 12,000 killed and 66,000 wounded.
In the "Small Plan" (''Kleine Planung''), the population of Warsaw was to be limited to 500,000 people. The first group affected by this measure was Warsaw's Jewish population, which the German planners assumed would be removed (''Judenaussiedlung'') from an area of around 482 hm² and forcibly relocated to a "[[Jewish quarter (diaspora)|Jewish Quarter]]" (''Judenviertel'') which was 3.5 times smaller, i.e. 143 hm² surrounded by walls and watchtowers. In 1940, the Nazis turned the northern part of mid-town Warsaw (Wola and Muranow) into a Jewish ghetto. The [[Warsaw Ghetto|Jewish Ghetto]] was planned to accommodate around 30,000 of the capital's inhabitants that were of Jewish origin; however it eventually held nearly 400,000 people living in deplorable conditions. The next step for decreasing the original population of the city was the systematic displacement of people captured and destined for either [[slave labor]] in the Third Reich or extermination in [[concentration camp|concentration]] and [[labor camp]]s. As early as 1940 all inhabitants of Warsaw were subject to round-ups (łapanki) and mass shootings in the streets. Nearly 250,000 civilians were eventually murdered this way. Memorial plaques can be seen throughout Warsaw today commemorating this indiscriminate program of ethnic cleansing men, women and children. Those who did not manage to escape were sent to death camps at [[Auschwitz]] or [[Majdanek]] or forced into labour in Germany. Among the 2,857,500 Poles [[Forced labour under German rule during World War II|working as slave labor in the Third Reich during World War II]], a significant percentage was composed of Warsaw and [[Warsaw Voivodeship (1919–1939)|Warsaw province]] inhabitants. [[Image:Alfred Jodl, Hans Frank, Alfred Rosenberg.jpg|thumb|upright|[[Hans Frank]] (center, wearing a glove after a suicide attempt shortly after his arrest) at the [[Nuremberg trial]], with [[Alfred Jodl]] and [[Alfred Rosenberg]]]] On 6 February 1940 the German mayor of the city presented an unusual gift to [[Hans Frank]], the Governor-General of the Occupied Polish Territories. The gift was a full documentation of the new German town Warsaw (''Neue deutsche Stadt Warschau''), the so-called Pabst Plan, prepared by German architects Hubert Gross and Otto Nurnberger.
On October 9, 1942 [[Heinrich Himmler]] ordered the creation of the [[Warsaw concentration camp]] (''Konzentrationslager Warschau - KL Warschau'') which consisted of the Koło district camp (''Kriegsgefangenenlager Warschau'', 1939) and two other camps in the proximity of Dworzec Zachodni (Western Train Station, 1942): the Gęsia camp (Gęsia Street Camp, 1943) and the Bonifraterska camp (Bonifraterska Street Camp, 1943). KL Warschau was functioning until August 28, 1944 when the German government of the city ordered the [[Death march|evacuation of its prisoners]] into the Third Reich, out of fear that the ongoing [[Warsaw Uprising (1944)|Warsaw Uprising]] might result in freeing them. The prisoners were transported to concentration camps in Third Reich: [[Dachau concentration camp|Dachau]], [[Landsberg am Lech#Landsberg Concentration Camp and displaced person camp|Landsberg]], [[Mühldorf subcamp|Mühldorf]], [[Kaufering concentration camp|Kaufering]], [[Gross-Rosen]] and [[Ravensbrück]].
== See also == * [[Planned destruction of Warsaw]] * [[Nazi architecture]] * [[Welthauptstadt Germania]] * [[Chronicles of Terror]]
== Bibliography == * Stanisław Jankowski, Adolf Ciborowski "Warszawa 1945 i dziś" Publisher: Wydawnictwo Interpress, Warszawa, 1971, * Andrzej Leszek Szcześniak "Nowe niemieckie miasto Warschau" Warschau muss sterben Adolf Hitler, Nasza Polska, 18.09.2002 * Niels Gutschow, Barbara Klain, "Zagłada i utopia. Urbanistyka Warszawy w latach 1939-1945" (katalog wystawy), Muzeum Historyczne, Warszawa 2003 * Niels Gutschow, Barbarta Klain: Vernichtung und Utopie. Stadtplanung Warschau 1939–1945, Hamburg 1994, {{ISBN|3-88506-223-2}}
== References == {{Reflist|close}}
== External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20071025151112/http://www.archiwa.gov.pl/memory/sub_listakrajowa/index.php?va_lang=pl&fileid=020 Fragment of Pabst Plan - 1942] * {{Cite web | last = | first = | title = Die Zerstörung Warschaus auf dem Reißbrett | url = https://www.meeviertel-anzeiger.de/Anz_Sept_10.pdf | publisher = | date = | accessdate = 24 May 2013 }} * [http://www.chroniclesofterror.pl/dlibra/publication/404/edition/392/content?navq=aHR0cDovL3d3dy5jaHJvbmljbGVzb2Z0ZXJyb3IucGwvZGxpYnJhL3Jlc3VsdHM_cT1jemVybnkmYWN0aW9uPVNpbXBsZVNlYXJjaEFjdGlvbiZtZGlyaWRzPSZ0eXBlPS02JnN0YXJ0c3RyPV9hbGwmcD0w&navref=NDA0OzM5Mg Testimony of Władysław Czerny concerning realisation of Pabst Plan in Warsaw]

[[File:Toledot Ha-Poskim.jpg|thumb|300px|''Toledot HaPoskim, History of the Jewish Codes'', by Chaim Tchernowitz.]] '''Posek''' ({{lang-he-n|פוסק}} {{IPA-he|poˈsek|}}, pl. '''Poskim''', {{Hebrew|פוסקים}} {{IPA-he|pos'kim|}}) is the term in [[Halakha|Jewish law]] for a "decisor" — a legal scholar who determines the position of ''[[Halakha]]'' in cases of law where previous authorities are inconclusive, or in those situations where no clear ''halakhic'' precedent exists.
The decision of a posek is known as a '''''psak din''''' or '''''psak halakha''''' ("ruling of law"; pl. ''piskei din'', ''piskei halakha'') or simply a "psak". In Hebrew, פסק is the [[Root (linguistics)|root]] implying to "stop" or "cease"—the posek brings the process of legal debate to finality. ''Piskei din'' are generally recorded in the [[responsa]] literature.
== Formulating a ruling (psak din) == In formulating a ruling, a posek will base the ''psak din'' on a careful analysis of the relevant [[Legal doctrine|underlying legal principles]],<ref>{{cite web |title=The Kosher Get: A Halakhic Story of Divorce |quote=trained in halakhic psak ... proper subject of analysis ... embody the individual posek's .. |url=http://www.academia.edu/31883079/The_Kosher_Get_A_Halakhic_Story_of_Divorce}}</ref> as well as a careful study of the application of these principles. A Posek must therefore be thoroughly versed in [[rabbinic literature]], from the [[Talmud#Talmud Bavli (Babylonian Talmud)|Babylonian Talmud]], through the major medieval codifications of the Law and up to recent decisors.
The process of analysis usually entails today: # an initial study of the relevant [[Talmud]]ic ''[[Gemara#The Sugya|Sugyas]]'' with [[Talmud#Commentaries|commentaries]]; # tracing the development of all related material in the ''[[Rishonim]]'' (Medieval rabbinic authorities prior to the ''[[Shulkhan Aruch]])'' through the ''[[Arba'ah Turim]]'' and ''[[Shulkhan Arukh]]''; # and finally, a close analysis of the works of the ''[[Acharonim]]'' (rabbinic authorities from about the 16th century onwards) discussing the halakha as recorded in the literature of the ''Rishonim'' (and earlier ''Acharonim'').
The ruling itself is an attempt to apply the precedents and principles of the [[Tradition]] to the question being asked.<ref>{{cite web |title=Contemporary Halakhic Problems, Vol V, Introduction |url=https://www.sefaria.org/Contemporary_Halakhic_Problems%2C_Vol_V%2C_Introduction |quote=The decisor .. understanding .. underlying principles and postulates of Halakhah}}</ref> One common goal of poskim in this regard is, as far as possible, to be [[consistent]] with the [[Halakha#Codes of Jewish law|codified law]], as well as with the maximal relevant [[legal precedent]]s, generally being decisions recorded in the [[responsa]] literature.
== The role of the Posek ==
=== Orthodox Judaism === Poskim play an integral role in [[Orthodox Judaism]] in general and [[Haredi Judaism]] in particular. * In the Haredi world, each community will regard one of its ''poskim'' as its ''Posek HaDor'' ("Posek of the present Generation"). * [[Hasidic Judaism|Hasidic Jews]] rely on the Rov in their community (sometimes but not always [[Rebbe]]s also get the position as Rov) or leading posek recommended by their [[Rebbe]]. Yet there are some Jews who are Hasidic but are not part of a specific movement. These hassidim will vary in who they follow sometimes following generic hassid-style poskim like [[Shmuel Wosner|Rav Shmuel Wosner]]. * [[Modern Orthodox Judaism|Modern Orthodox]] Jews may select a posek on a more individual rather than a communal basis, although customs vary. The approach taken here will, generally, be as above. Thus ''poskim'' will not overrule a specific law, unless based on an earlier authority: a posek will generally extend a law to new situations, but will not ''change'' the Halakhah; see [[Orthodox Judaism#Beliefs about Jewish law and tradition|further]] under [[Orthodox Judaism]].
In 2014 the first ever book of [[halacha|halachic]] decisions written by women who were ordained to serve as poskim (Idit Bartov and Anat Novoselsky) was published.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://jpupdates.com/2014/06/26/first-halacha-sefer-women-makes-waves-israel-orthodox-world/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-03-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150325221418/http://jpupdates.com/2014/06/26/first-halacha-sefer-women-makes-waves-israel-orthodox-world/ |archivedate=2015-03-25 |df= }}</ref> The women were ordained by the municipal chief rabbi of Efrat, Rabbi [[Shlomo Riskin]], after completing [[Midreshet Lindenbaum]] women’s college’s five-year ordination course in advanced studies in Jewish law, as well as passing examinations equivalent to the rabbinate’s requirement for men.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://jpupdates.com/2014/06/26/first-halacha-sefer-women-makes-waves-israel-orthodox-world/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-03-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150325221418/http://jpupdates.com/2014/06/26/first-halacha-sefer-women-makes-waves-israel-orthodox-world/ |archivedate=2015-03-25 |df= }}</ref>
=== Conservative Judaism === [[Conservative Judaism]] approaches the idea of ''Posek'', and Halakha in general, somewhat differently, and Poskim here apply a relatively lower weighting to precedent, and will thus frequently re-interpret (or even change) a law through a formal argument; see [[Conservative Halakha]]. Although there are some "''poskim''" in the Conservative movement - e.g. Rabbis [[Louis Ginzberg]], [[David Golinkin]], [[Joel Roth]], and [[Elliot N. Dorff|Elliot Dorff]] - the rulings of any one individual rabbi are considered less authoritative than a consensus ruling. Thus, the Conservative movement's [[Rabbinical Assembly]] maintains a [[Committee on Jewish Law and Standards]], whose decisions are accepted as authoritative within the American Conservative movement. At the same time, every Conservative rabbi has the right as ''[[mara d'atra]]'' to interpret Jewish law for his own community, regardless of the responsa of the Law Committee.[https://web.archive.org/web/20080109044437/http://uscj.org/Revised_Standards_fo7505.html]
=== Progressive Judaism === Both [[Reform Judaism|Reform]] and [[Reconstructionist Judaism]] do not regard the halakha as binding.
Although Reform stresses the individual autonomy of its membership, it never completely abandoned the field of Responsa literature, if only to counter its rivals' demands. Even Classical Reformers such as Rabbi [[David Einhorn (rabbi)|David Einhorn]] composed some. Rabbi [[Solomon Freehof]], and his successor Rabbi [[Walter Jacob]], attempted to create a concept of "Progressive Halacha", authoring numerous responsa based on a methodology laying great emphasis on current sensibilities and ethical ideals. Full text collections of Reform responsa are available on the website of the [[Central Conference of American Rabbis]].<ref>Walter Jacob, ''Liberal Judaism and Halakhah'', Rodef Shalom Press, 1988. pp. 90-94.; Michael A. Meyer, ''[https://www.jstor.org/stable/23536120 Changing Attitudes of Liberal Judaism toward Halakhah and Minhag]'', Proceedings of the World Congress of Jewish Studies, 1993. See a collection of [http://ccarnet.org/rabbis-speak/reform-responsa/ CCAR Responsa].</ref>
The Reconstructionist position is that if Jews would have formed cohesive communities again, their rulings would be binding, yet presently Judaism is in a "post-Halakhic state". Therefore, their basic policy is to allow tradition "a vote, not a veto" in communal and personal affairs.<ref>Jonathan Sacks, ''Crisis and Covenant: Jewish Thought After the Holocaust'', Manchester University Press, 1992. p. 158.</ref>
== List of poskim and major works ==
=== Poskim of past years ===

{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2017}} {{Close paraphrasing|date=May 2017}} {{Infobox legislation |short_title = Proclamation No. 216 |long_title = Declaring a State of Martial Law and Suspending the Privilege of the Writ of Habeas Corpus in the Whole of Mindanao |image = Seal_of_the_President_of_the_Philippines.svg |imagesize = 150px |imagealt = |citation = [http://www.officialgazette.gov.ph/downloads/2017/05may/20170523-PROC-216-RRD.pdf Proclamation No. 216, s. 2017] |territorial_extent = Whole of [[Mindanao]] |signed_by = [[Rodrigo Duterte]] |date_enacted = |date_assented = |date_signed = May 23, 2017 |date_commenced = |bill = |bill_citation = |bill_date = |introduced_by = |1st_reading = |2nd_reading = |3rd_reading = |white_paper = |committee_report = |amendments = |repeals = |related = |summary = |keywords = [[Martial law in the Philippines|Martial law]], [[rebellion]], [[Terrorism in the Philippines|terrorism]] |status = in force }} '''Proclamation No. 216''' is the 2017 [[Ordinance Power of the President of the Philippines#Proclamations|proclamation]] of [[Martial Law in the Philippines|martial law]] and suspension of the [[habeas corpus|privilege of the writ of habeas corpus]] in the whole of [[Mindanao]], issued by [[Philippine President]] [[Rodrigo Duterte]] on May 23, 2017.
==History== [[File:Martial law in Mindanao 2017 doc.jpg|thumb|Proclamation No. 216]]
{{see also|Battle of Marawi}} ===Declaration=== At 10:00 p.m. [[Philippine Standard Time|PST]] ([[UTC+08:00]]) on May 23, 2017, amid a [[Maute Group]]-related escalation of conflicts in [[Mindanao]] as well as [[Battle of Marawi|recent clashes]] in [[Marawi]] between the Armed Forces of the Philippines and the Islamist group, [[Philippine President]] [[Rodrigo Duterte]] placed the whole of Mindanao, including [[Basilan]], [[Sulu]], and [[Tawi-Tawi]], under [[Martial Law in the Philippines|martial law]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/05/23/17/duterte-declares-martial-law-in-mindanao|title=Duterte declares Martial Law in Mindanao|last=|first=|work=ABS-CBN News|access-date=May 23, 2017|language=en-US}}</ref> The proclamation was announced during a press briefing held in [[Moscow]], where Duterte was on [[List of international presidential trips made by Rodrigo Duterte#Russia (May 22–24)|an official visit]]; the state of martial law will be in effect for 60 days. [[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)#Presidential Spokesperson|Presidential Spokesperson]] [[Ernesto Abella]] said the declaration was possible given the "existence of rebellion," while [[Secretary of Foreign Affairs (Philippines)|Foreign Secretary]] [[Alan Peter Cayetano]] explained that the step was taken with "the safety, the lives and property of people of Mindanao" in mind.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/170745-philippines-duterte-declares-martial-law-mindanao|title=Duterte declares martial law in Mindanao|work=Rappler|access-date=May 24, 2017|language=en}}</ref> Implementation is to be pursuant to the [[1987 Constitution]], which provides for a maximum 60 day-state of martial law without [[Congress of the Philippines|Congress]] approval for extension, the continuation of government functions, and the safeguard of individual freedoms. However, Duterte insisted that it will not be any different from [[Proclamation No. 1081|martial law]] under President [[Ferdinand Marcos]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/170759-duterte-martial-law-no-different-marcos|title=Duterte says his martial law to be similar to Marcos time|work=Rappler|access-date=May 24, 2017|language=en}}</ref>
While the declaration does not currently affect citizens and government units in [[Luzon]] or the [[Visayas]], Duterte suggested that he might extend the suspension of the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus to Visayas<ref name="cnnsuspendwrit">{{cite news|last1=Bacungan|first1=VJ|title=Duterte suspends privilege of writ of habeas corpus in Mindanao|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/05/24/president-duterte-suspend-privilege-writ-of-habeas-corpus-mindanao.html|publisher=CNN Philippines|date=May 25, 2017}}</ref> and martial law to the entire country if needed to "protect the people."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-40024120|title=Philippine President Duterte eyes nationwide martial law|date=May 24, 2017|work=BBC News|access-date=May 24, 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref>
The Congress approved of a resolution supporting the measure on May 31, 2017<ref name="ok">{{cite news|last1=Avendaño|first1=Christine|last2=Yap|first2=DJ|title=Martial law gets Congress OK|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/901512/martial-law-gets-congress-ok|accessdate=26 October 2017|work=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=1 June 2017}}</ref>
===First extension=== On July 23, 2017, lawmakers voted 261–18 (with no abstention among those present) in favor of the President [[Rodrigo Duterte]]'s request to give extension to Proclamation Order No. 216 during a special joint session of the [[17th Congress of the Philippines|House of Representatives and the Senate]]. This extension was valid until December 31, 2017.<ref name="CNN_mLaw">{{cite news|last1=Santos|first1=Eimor|last2=Garcia|first2=Pia|title=Congress grants Duterte's request to extend martial law in Mindanao until end of year|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/07/22/Congress-votes-martial-law-extension-Duterte.html|accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=''CNN Philippines''|date=July 22, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Yap|first1=DJ|last2=Uy|first2=Jocelyn|last3=Salaverria|first3=Leila|title=Congress votes to extend martial law|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/916245/congress-votes-to-extend-martial-law|accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=''Philippine Daily Inquirer''|date=July 23, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Cepeda|first1=Mara|title=Congress extends martial law to December 31|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/176345-congress-extend-martial-law-december|accessdate=23 July 2017|publisher=''Rappler''|date=July 22, 2017}}</ref>
The majority number required for the approval of martial law is at 158 of the 314 members of Congress.<ref name="CNN_mLaw" />
Under the Constitution, the President can declare martial law for an initial period of 60 days and ask for its extension in case of rebellion, invasion or when public safety requires it.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/update-2-congress-votes-extend-martial-law-mindanao-dec-31-2017/339879/|title=UPDATE 2: Congress votes to extend martial law in Mindanao until Dec. 31, 2017 - The Manila Times Online|website=www.manilatimes.net|language=en-US|access-date=2017-07-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= Congress Extends Martial Law in Mindanao Until End of 2017 - Sunstar Daily Online|url=http://www.sunstar.com.ph/manila/local-news/2017/07/22/congress-extends-martial-law-mindanao-until-end-2017-554325|accessdate=22 July 2017|work=[[Sun.Star Cebu]]|date=2017-07-22}}</ref>
The incumbent Senators who voted for '''NO''' are as follows:<ref name= "Rappler lst" >{{cite news|title= LIST: How the 17th Congress voted on the martial law extension|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/176378-how-17th-congress-voted-mindanao-martial-law-extension|work=[[Rappler]]|date=July 22, 2017}}</ref> {{Columns-list|colwidth=30em| # [[Bam Aquino]] # [[Franklin Drilon]] # [[Risa Hontiveros]] # [[Francis Pangilinan]] }}
The incumbent Representatives who voted for '''NO''' are as follows:<ref name= "Rappler lst" /> {{Columns-list|colwidth=30em| # Gary Alejano ([[Magdalo para sa Pilipino|Magdalo]]) # [[Lito Atienza]] ([[Buhay Hayaan Yumabong|Buhay]]) # [[Teddy Baguilat]] ([[Legislative district of Ifugao|Ifugao Lone District]]) # Jose Christopher Belmonte ([[Legislative districts of Quezon City|Quezon City 6th District]]) # Gabriel Bordado ([[Legislative districts of Camarines Sur|Camarines Sur 3rd District]]) # Arlene Brosas ([[Gabriela Women's Party]]) # Ariel Casilao ([[Anakpawis]]) # France Castro ([[Alliance of Concerned Teachers|ACT Teachers]]) # Emmi de Jesus ([[Gabriela Women's Party]]) # Sarah Elago ([[Kabataan]]) # [[Edcel Lagman]] ([[Legislative districts of Albay|Albay 1st District]]) # [[Antonio Tinio]] ([[Alliance of Concerned Teachers|ACT Teachers]]) # Tom Villarin ([[Akbayan]]) # [[Carlos Isagani Zarate]] ([[Bayan Muna]]) }}
The incumbent Senators who were '''ABSENT''' are as follows:<ref>{{cite news|title= Congress extends martial law until December 31|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2017/07/23/1720699/congress-extends-martial-law-until-december-31|work=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=July 22, 2017}}</ref> {{Columns-list|colwidth=30em| # [[Nancy Binay]] # [[Leila de Lima]] (''detained'') # [[Antonio Trillanes]] }}

one year |opinions = |keywords = <!-- {{hlist | }} --> |italic title = no }} On December 13, 2017, a special joint session of the House of Representatives and the Senate was held in order to respond to President Rodrigo Duterte's request to extend the declaration of martial law in Mindanao until December 31, 2018. In his letter addressed to the Congress, President Duterte cited the remaining threats of ISIS-inspired terrorist groups. Congress voted 240–27 (14–4 from the Senate, 226–23 from the House) in favor of the second extension.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Viray|first1=Patricia Lourdes|title=Congress approves one-year martial law extension in Mindanao|url=http://beta.philstar.com/headlines/2017/12/13/1768028/congress-approves-one-year-martial-law-extension-mindanao|accessdate=January 8, 2018|work=The Philippine Star|date=December 13, 2017}}</ref>
Four petitions were filed before the Philippine Supreme Court questioning the year-long extension of martial law in Mindanao.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/959954/sc-consolidates-four-petitions-vs-martial-law-extension-martial-law-mindanao-sc-petitions|title=SC consolidates four petitions vs martial law extension|last=Leonen|first=Julius N.|date=January 13, 2018|work=Inquirer|access-date=2018-05-11|language=en}}</ref> Among the petitioners were one of the framers of the 1987 Philippine Constitution Christian Monsod, a former Commission on Elections chairperson,<ref name=":0" /> and opposition lawmakers.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.philstar.com/headlines/2018/01/11/1776473/what-petitioners-vs-martial-law-will-argue-supreme-court|title=What petitioners vs martial law will argue before the Supreme Court|last=Patag|first=Kristine Joy|date=January 11, 2018|website=Philstar|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-05-11}}</ref> Petitioners contended that the extension lacked factual basis, citing government reports that Marawi City had been liberated.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/02/10/dissenting-SC-justices-martial-law-Mindanao.html|title=Dissenting SC justices: No need for martial law in Mindanao|last=Bacungan,|first=VJ|date=February 10, 2018|work=CNN|access-date=2018-05-11|language=en}}</ref>
On December 5, 2017, the Supreme Court voted 10-3-1 upholding the implementation of martial law in Mindanao,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/12/05/Supreme-Court-martial-law-Mindanao.html|title=Supreme Court upholds ruling on declaration of martial law in Mindanao|last=|first=|date=December 5, 2017|work=CNN|access-date=2018-05-11|language=en}}</ref> with Supreme Court Justice Noel Tijam saying that the extension was necessary because of persisting rebellion.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2018/02/10/dissenting-SC-justices-martial-law-Mindanao.html|title=Dissenting SC justices: No need for martial law in Mindanao|last=|first=|date=February 10, 2018|work=CNN|access-date=2018-05-11|language=en}}</ref> Dissenting opinion by Supreme Court Associate Justice Marvic Leonen stated that the re-extension of martial law "enables the rise of an emboldened authoritarian."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/195728-martial-law-leonen-dissenting-opinion-supreme-court|title=SC martial law ruling 'enables rise of an emboldened authoritarian' – Leonen|last=Buan|first=Lian|date=February 10, 2018|work=Rappler|access-date=2018-05-11|language=en}}</ref> {| class="wikitable collapsible" style="text-align: center; font-size:95%;" |- !colspan=2|Supreme Court decision on the validity of the extension of Martial Law in Mindanao |- !In Favor (10) !Opposed (5) |- | *[[Noel G. Tijam]] *[[Presbitero J. Velasco, Jr.]] *[[Teresita De Castro]] *[[Diosdado M. Peralta]] *[[Lucas P. Bersamin]] *[[Mariano del Castillo]] *[[Estela Perlas-Bernabe]] *[[Samuel R. Martires]] *[[Andres Reyes Jr.]] *[[Alexander Gesmundo]] | *[[Maria Lourdes Sereno]] *[[Antonio Carpio]] *[[Presbitero Velasco Jr.]] *[[Francis Jardeleza]] *[[Marvic Leonen]] *[[Alfredo Benjamin Caguioa]]. |}
==Reactions== President Duterte's declaration of martial law in the entire Mindanao region was met with polarized views from the citizens with some reports indicating mixed reactions. However, actual surveys on the ground indicate that majority of Filipinos are in favor of its imposition.<ref name="rappler3">{{cite web|url=http://www.rappler.com/technology/social-media/170749-martial-law-mindanao-netizens-reactions |title=Netizens terrified or trusting of martial law in Mindanao |publisher=Rappler.com |date=May 14, 2017 |accessdate=May 25, 2017}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/632794/majority-of-filipinos-still-favor-extended-mindanao-martial-law-sws-survey/story/ |title=Majority of Filipinos still favor extended Mindanao martial law —SWS survey |publisher=GMA News Online|date=November 11, 2017}}</ref>
===Public figures=== Some lawmakers from Mindanao expressed their views on the president's declaration of martial law. Mindanao lawmakers led by [[Speaker of the House of Representatives of the Philippines|Speaker]] [[Pantaleon Alvarez]] said Wednesday, May 24 that the declaration of martial law in Mindanao is justifiable, given the other security problems faced by the region. [[Surigao del Sur]] 2nd District Representative Johnny Pimentel shared the same sentiment. He said martial law will help address his province’s longstanding "insurgency problem". [[Davao City]] 1st District Representative Karlo Nograles, who called the crisis in Marawi as a “clear case of rebellion," said martial rule will help confine the fighting. Alvarez and Nograles also noted that the 1987 Constitution has safeguards against abuse in relation to martial law.<ref>{{cite web|author=Mara Cepeda |url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/170792-alvarez-mindanao-lawmakers-justify-martial-law |title=Alvarez, Mindanao lawmakers justify martial law declaration |publisher=[[Rappler]] |date=May 24, 2017 |accessdate=May 25, 2017}}</ref> Senator [[Manny Pacquiao]] said “I fully support the declaration of martial law in Mindanao by President Rodrigo Duterte. I believe this is timely and necessary in the light of political turmoil perpetrated by the Moro extremists in Marawi City.” Senators [[Antonio Trillanes IV]] and [[Bam Aquino]], on the other hand, questioned President Duterte's declaration of a martial law in Mindanao. According to former President [[Fidel Ramos]], "the martial law that will happen could be more harmful" (compared to [[Ferdinand Marcos]]'s time).<ref name="youtubeRamos">{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xUszP7nOb5w|title=Ramos fears 'more harmful' martial law under Duterte|date=May 26, 2017|publisher=[[Rappler]]}}</ref>
On May 30, 2017, the majority bloc of the Senate adopted a resolution expressing support for President Duterte's declaration of martial law in Mindanao, saying that the proclamation is required for public safety while at the same time clarifying the operation of the 1987 Constitution. The resolution passed the Senate in a 17–5 vote. The opponents of the resolution, all minority bloc senators, filed another resolution calling for a [[Joint session#Philippines|joint session of Congress]] to decide on the proclamation.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Avendaño|first1=Christine|title=17 senators express support for Duterte’s martial law|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/901100/17-senators-express-support-for-dutertes-martial-law|accessdate=May 30, 2017|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=May 30, 2017}}</ref> Their resolution failed the Senate in a 12–9 vote.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lardizabal|first1=Cecille|title=Senate backs martial law, junks call to convene joint session|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/05/30/Senate-junks-joint-session-martial-law.html|accessdate=May 30, 2017|publisher=[[CNN Philippines]]|date=May 30, 2017}}</ref>
===Catholic Church=== Catholic bishops in Mindanao believe that President Duterte's declaration of martial law in the region should only be temporary. Cardinal [[Orlando Quevedo]], the [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Cotabato|Archbishop of Cotabato]], said that the Church is aware of the declaration's necessity to solve issues of peace and order and that the Church does not have "solid and sufficient" facts to protest the declaration as "morally reprehensible". He urged the Mindanaoan people to remain calm but vigilant as to ensure that the implementation of martial law would not be abused. Quevado added that the Church is prepared to fully condemn the declaration of martial law "if it goes in the way of evil."<ref>{{cite news|last1=Valente|first1=Catherine|title=Mindanao bishops ‘not against’ martial law|url=http://www.manilatimes.net/mindanao-bishops-not-martial-law/329635/|accessdate=June 1, 2017|work=[[The Manila Times]]|date=May 27, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Aurelio|first1=Julie|title=Bishops neutral on martial law, but…|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/900236/bishops-neutral-on-martial-law-but|accessdate=June 1, 2017|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=May 28, 2017}}</ref> [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Ozamiz|Ozamiz Archbishop]] Martin Jumoad supports the declaration of martial law, but believes that there should be a "mechanism" to ensure that the implementation would not violate human rights.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rosauro|first1=Ryan|title=Mindanao bishops throw support behind Martial Law|url=http://www.sunstar.com.ph/cagayan-de-oro/local-news/2017/05/28/mindanao-bishops-throw-support-behind-martial-law-544316|accessdate=June 1, 2017|work=[[Sun.Star]]|date=May 28, 2017}}</ref>
===Muslim community=== {{further|Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao}} A group of lawyers from the Philippine Muslim Society is planning to oppose before the [[Supreme Court of the Philippines|Supreme Court]] the president's declaration of martial law in Mindanao.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/05/24/Martial-law-Philippines-Duterte.html|title=EXCLUSIVE: Muslim lawyers to challenge martial law declaration before Supreme Court|publisher=|accessdate=May 25, 2017}}</ref>
===Business sector=== Philippine financial markets weakened in early trading on March 24, 2017 as the [[PSE Composite Index|Philippine Stock Exchange Composite Index]] (PSEi) was down 0.42 percent to 7,779.73, before rallying to close at 7,837.82, up by 0.33 percent or 25.68 points, which a trader attributed to investors remaining positive on the domestic market despite the developments in Mindanao.<ref name="interaksyon">{{cite web|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/psei-up-peso-weakens-after-martial-law-declaration-in-mindanao/ |title=PSEi up, Peso weakens after martial law declaration in Mindanao |publisher=[[Interaksyon]] |author=Villanueva, J.S. |date=May 24, 2017 |accessdate=May 27, 2017}}</ref><ref name="abs-cbn1">{{cite web|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/business/05/24/17/marawi-fighting-stirs-uncertainty-in-financial-markets |title=Marawi fighting stirs uncertainty in financial markets | ABS-CBN News |publisher=News.abs-cbn.com |date=May 24, 2017 |accessdate=May 25, 2017}}</ref>
Investors are monitoring closely how Duterte will use martial law to fight the long-running extremist problem in the south, analysts said. [[Bank of the Philippine Islands|BPI Securities]] research head Haj Narvaez told Cathy Yang on [[ABS-CBN News Channel|ANC]]'s ''Market Edge'' that the incident caused uncertainties which made investors to be more conservative in their decisions. Narvaez projects "some downward pressure" probably in the next 1 to 2 weeks and says that investors will assess if the situation in Mindanao can be controlled. Tycoon and philanthropist [[Washington SyCip]] said the President cutting short a foreign visit due to security worries was "not the publicity that we need. I think worldwide, the word martial law is not the best thing."<ref name="abs-cbn1"/>
Amidst fighting in Marawi and fears of martial law, numerous overseas tourists have cancelled hotel and resort bookings in the Visayas region.<ref name="touristsCancelBookings">{{cite news|last1=Lato|first1=Cris Evert|title=Tourists cancel bookings in PH|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/900412/tourists-cancel-bookings-in-ph|publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=May 29, 2017}}</ref>
==Actions by the government== ===Armed Forces of the Philippines directive=== The [[Department of National Defense (Philippines)|Department of National Defense]] issued a guidance to the [[Armed Forces of the Philippines]] and its attached bureaus regarding the proper implementation of martial law in [[Mindanao]].<ref name="afp">{{cite web|url=https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/899475/dnd-issues-martial-law-memo-to-troops-in-mindanao |title=DND issues ‘martial law memo’ to troops in Mindanao |publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]] |author=Mangosing, F. |date=May 25, 2017 |accessdate=May 26, 2017}}</ref> The memorandum states:
{{quotation|Please be guided that the declaration of Martial Law in the island of Mindanao does not suspend the operation of the Constitution, nor supplement the functioning of the Philippine judicial and legislative assemblies, nor authorize the conferment of jurisdiction on military courts and agencies over civilian where civil courts are able to function, nor automatically suspend the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus.<ref name="afp"/>}}
{{quotation|In this connection, the AFP and all bureaus and agencies of this Department are hereby enjoined that the rule of law and human rights should prevail in the place or part of the Philippines where the Martial Law was declared and effective.<ref name="afp"/>}}
{{quotation|Any arrest, search and seizure executed or implemented in the area or place where Martial Law is effective, including the filing of charges, should comply with the Revised Rules of Court and applicable jurisprudence.<ref name="afp"/>}}
{{quotation|DND bureaus and agencies involved in humanitarian activities are hereby enjoined to institute appropriate action on those affected and displaced persons by providing adequate assistance in coordination with other government agencies.<ref name="afp"/>}}
===Government roundups in Davao City=== On May 25, 2017, after authorities received information on the presence of unidentified and suspicious-looking persons, around 250 individuals have been rounded up in the barangays of Bucana and Mini-Forest in [[Davao City]] as "persons of interest" for not being able to present proof of identification. According to Davao City Police Office Senior Supt. Alexander Tagum, they were at DPCO headquarters to undergo "a verification process" and were not under arrest. He said their operation is part of their efforts to prevent the entry of terrorists in one of Mindanao's biggest cities.<ref name="cnnphilauthoritiesroundup">{{cite news|last1=Tesiorna|first1=Ben|title=Authorities round up 250 persons of interest in Davao|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/regional/2017/05/25/authorities-250-persons-of-interest-davao.html|publisher=CNN Philippines|date=May 25, 2017}}</ref>
===Censorship and suppression in Mindanao=== On Friday, May 26, 2017, the [[Armed Forces of the Philippines]] stated that it would censor [[News media|the press]] and [[social media]] to "protect national security" across Mindanao, and warned that violators would be arrested.<ref name="yahoocensorship">{{cite web|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/philippine-military-flags-martial-law-censorship-005831854.html|title=Philippine military flags martial law censorship|date=May 26, 2017|publisher=[[Agence France-Presse]]}}</ref> According to military spokesman Brigadier General Restituto Padilla, "We'll exercise the right to censure, (sic)" and that it would be based on 3 conditions: to ensure the safety of lives, to ensure operational security and to ensure the safety of men in uniform who are fighting, and for other national security considerations.<ref name="yahoocensorship"/><ref name="gmaafpcensure">{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/612247/afp-to-censure-media-social-media-over-security-considerations/story/|title=AFP to exercise ‘right to censure’ over security considerations|date=May 26, 2017|publisher=GMA News Online}}</ref>
"''Kaya ngayon umaapela kami maaga pa lang na i-exercise 'nyo ang common sense, na 'pag alam ninyo na ito’y nakakasama at hindi nakakatulong, ‘wag 'nyo na ‘ho i-post. Baka minsan na lang, kakatukin na lang kayo ng pulis at aarestuhin kayo,''”<ref name="rappleryoutubepadilla">{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9HFUCpjhJsw|title=Video Interview: AFP to 'exercise right to censure' under martial law|date=May 26, 2017|publisher=[[Rappler]]}}</ref> (This early, we’re appealing to the public to exercise their common sense. If you know that what you're posting does harm and does not help, don’t post it. You might just find the police knocking on your door to arrest you.) according to Padilla.<ref name="rapplercensorship">{{cite web|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/171029-afp-martial-law-censorship|title=AFP to 'exercise right to censure' under martial law|author=Bea Cupin|date=May 26, 2017|publisher=[[Rappler]]}}</ref>
Likewise, the Philippine National Police in Davao region (Police Regional Office 11, or PRO-11) stated that the right to form a public assembly such as protests or rallies against the government would be curtailed with the declaration of Martial Law in Mindanao. PRO-11 said that leaders and organizers of groups that will stage protests or rallies would be arrested if caught making a public nuisance.<ref name="davaopolicearrestprotesters">{{cite news|last1=Lopez|first1=Alex D.|title=Be warned: Davao police to arrest protesters in line with ML declaration|url=http://davaotoday.com/main/politics/be-warned-davao-police-to-arrest-protesters-in-line-with-ml-declaration/|publisher=Davao Today|date=May 26, 2017}}</ref>
===Further statements from Duterte=== On the same Friday, Duterte expressed his intention to take responsibility for the actions of soldiers in Mindanao during the implementation of martial law. He assured soldiers that they had his full support and stated: "If you go down, I go down. But for this martial law and the consequences of martial law and the ramifications of martial law, I and I alone would be responsible. ''Trabaho lang kayo. Ako na ang bahala. Ako na ang magpakulong sa inyo'' (Just do your job. I will take care of things. I'll be the one to be imprisoned for you)".
He then joked that soldiers would be free to rape and that he would be the one to go to jail for it. "''Pag naka-rape ka ng tatlo, aminin ko na akin iyon,''" (If you were to rape three, I'll admit that it was mine) according to Duterte.<ref name="dutertesupportsoldiersrape">{{cite news|last1=Macas|first1=Trisha|title=Duterte backs soldiers under martial law, jokes, ‘Maka-rape ka, akin yun’|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/612266/duterte-backs-soldiers-under-martial-law-jokes-maka-rape-ka-akin-yun/story/|publisher=GMA News Online|date=May 26, 2017}}</ref><ref name="rapeheinouscrime">{{cite news|last1=De Jesus|first1=Julliane Love|title=Duterte told: ‘Rape a heinous crime, never a laughing matter’|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/900121/duterte-told-rape-a-heinous-crime-never-a-laughing-matter|publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer|date=May 27, 2017}}</ref>
Amidst outrage from citizens, women's groups,<ref name="gmaRapeNotLaughingMatter">{{cite news|title=Group says rape not a laughing matter, cites cases 'involving' soldiers|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/612361/group-says-rape-not-a-laughing-matter-cites-cases-involving-soldiers/story/|publisher=[[GMA News]]|date=May 27, 2017}}</ref> human rights groups,<ref name="rapplerCHRRapeIsNeverAJoke">{{cite news|last1=Gavilan|first1=Jodesz|title=CHR to Duterte: Rape is never a joke|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/171209-commission-human-rights-duterte-rape-joke|publisher=[[Rappler]]|date=May 28, 2017}}</ref> and personalities like [[Chelsea Clinton]]<ref name="bbcDuterteSecondRapeJoke">{{cite news|title=Philippines' Duterte under fire for second rape joke|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-40072315|publisher=[[BBC News]]|date=May 27, 2017}}</ref> and Senator [[Risa Hontiveros]], Malacañang Presidential Spokesman [[Ernesto Abella]] defended Duterte's rape joke as "heightened bravado".<ref name="rapplerHeightenedBravado">{{cite news|title=Palace defends Duterte's rape joke as 'heightened bravado'|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/171151-palace-defends-duterte-rape-joke-bravado|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=[[Rappler]]|date=May 28, 2017}}</ref> Senator [[Manny Pacquiao]], likewise defended Duterte by stating "Just because he is the President, he can’t crack jokes anymore?"<ref name="inquirerClintonDaughter">{{cite news|title=Clinton daughter, others slam rape joke: ‘Not funny. Ever’|url=https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/900206/clinton-daughter-others-slam-rape-joke-not-funny-ever|publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=May 28, 2017}}</ref>
On Saturday, May 27, 2017, Duterte vowed that he would ignore Congress and the Supreme Court on the duration limits of martial law. He said: "''Hanggang hindi sinabi ng pulis pati Armed Forces na safe na ang Philippines, this martial law will continue. Hindi ako makinig sa iba. 'Yang Supreme Court, 'yang mga congressmen, wala naman sila dito. Bakit, sila ba ang nagpapakamatay? Sila ba ang naghirap dito? Sila ba 'yung – have they suffered the wounds of war? Sila ba 'yung nagtitiis?''" (Until the police and the Armed Forces say the Philippines is already safe, this martial law will continue. I won't listen to others. The Supreme Court, the congressmen, they're not here. Why, are they the ones risking their lives? Are they the ones suffering here? Are they – have they suffered the wounds of war? Are they the ones enduring this battle?)<ref name="rapplerOnlyAFP">{{cite news|title=Duterte: Only AFP, PNP can tell me to end martial law|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/171240-philippines-duterte-only-afp-pnp-end-martial-law|publisher=Rappler|date=May 28, 2017}}</ref><ref name="philstarDuterteWontListen">{{cite news|title=Duterte ‘won’t listen’ to Congress, SC on ML|url=http://www.philstar.com:8080/headlines/2017/05/29/1704646/duterte-wont-listen-congress-sc-ml|publisher=Philippine Star|date=May 29, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Duterte vows to ignore Supreme Court on martial law|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/612409/duterte-vows-to-ignore-supreme-court-on-martial-law/story/|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=GMA News|date=May 28, 2017}}</ref>
===Martial law cartoon=== [[File:PCOO Martial Law Propaganda Video Screen Capture.png|thumb|PCOO Martial Law Cartoon Video Screen Capture]]
On May 31, 2017, the [[Presidential Communications Group (Philippines)|Presidential Communications Operations Office (PCOO)]] released a cartoon video with the hashtag ''#DefendRepublic'' promoting Martial Law on the Internet via its official Twitter and Facebook accounts.<ref name="rapplermartiallawvideo">{{cite news|last1=Barreiro|first1=Victor|title=LOOK: Palace defends martial law in new social media video|url=http://www.rappler.com/technology/social-media/171544-palace-defends-martial-law-social-media-video|publisher=[[Rappler]]|date=May 31, 2017}}</ref><ref name="origtwittermartiallawvideo">{{cite web|title=PCOO Martial Law Propaganda Video|url=https://twitter.com/PresidentialCom/status/869841252321300481/video/1|website=Official Twitter Account of the Presidential Communications Operations Office|publisher=Presidential Communications Operations Office|accessdate=31 May 2017}}{{dead link|date=March 2018|fix-attempted=yes|bot=TweetCiteBot}}</ref> In it, a fearful boy is seen holding a shield with the words "Martial Law" inscribed on it, as silhouettes of professional-looking soldiers labeled "Extremist" march upon him, while a voiceover narrates:<ref name="streamablemirror">{{cite web|title=Mirror of PCOO Martial Law Propaganda Video|url=https://streamable.com/ajua2|website=Streamable|publisher=Philippine Presidential Communications Operations Office|accessdate=31 May 2017}}</ref>
{{quotation|In the free society, there are groups who don't want to give independence. They are adamant on detaining peaceful spirits. They are distressing feelings with fears. Let us not allow them to terrify us. We will all fight in unity. Martial law should be the rule of the land. Martial law, Now.<ref name="abscbnmartiallawvideo">{{cite news|title=Palace video: Martial law should be the rule of the land|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/05/31/17/palace-video-martial-law-should-be-the-rule-of-the-land|publisher=ABS-CBN News|date=June 1, 2017}}</ref><ref name="philstarpanoorinmartiallawvideo">{{cite news|title=PANOORIN: Kontrobersyal na binurang martial law video ng PCOO|url=http://www.philstar.com/bansa/2017/06/01/1705707/panoorin-kontrobersyal-na-binurang-martial-law-video-ng-pcoo|publisher=Philippine Star|date=June 1, 2017}}</ref>}}
The video was derided by netizens<ref name="philstarmartiallawvideo">{{cite news|last1=Imperio|first1=Christian|title=Martial law video ng PCOO, inulan ng batikos|url=http://www.philstar.com/bansa/2017/06/01/1705699/martial-law-video-ng-pcoo-inulan-ng-batikos|publisher=Philippine Star|date=June 1, 2017}}</ref> and senators due to its content, grammar and poor graphics and message that Martial Law should be treated as "the new normal", as well as for being a waste of taxpayer money.<ref name="gmanewspcoovideoreaksyon">{{cite news|title=Video diumano ng PCOO ukol sa martial law, umani ng samu't saring reaksyon|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/video/stateofthenation/414412/video-diumano-ng-pcoo-ukol-sa-martial-law-umani-ng-samut-saring-reaksyon/video/|publisher=GMA News|date=June 1, 2017}}</ref> The video was deleted by the PCOO shortly thereafter<ref name="straitstimesmartiallawvideo">{{cite news|title=Martial law now: Philippine president's communication office takes down propaganda video|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/martial-law-now-philippine-presidents-communication-office-takes-down-propaganda-video|publisher=Straits Times|date=May 31, 2017}}</ref> and disowned by the palace.<ref name="philstarmartiallawvideodisownedpalace">{{cite news|last1=Bolando|first1=AJ|title=Palace disowns deleted PCOO video promoting martial law|url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2017/06/01/1705710/palace-disowns-deleted-pcoo-video-promoting-martial-law|publisher=Philippine Star|date=June 1, 2017}}</ref>
==Relation to the CPP-NDF-NPA rebellion== On May 25, 2017, the [[Communist Party of the Philippines]] called on its armed wing, the [[New People's Army]], to "plan and carry out more tactical offensives across Mindanao and the entire archipelago" in response to the Philippine government's declaration of martial law.<ref name="npa1">{{cite web|url=https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/899587/cpp-orders-npa-to-launch-more-attacks-in-mindanao-other-regions |title=CPP orders NPA to launch more attacks in Mindanao, other regions |publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]] |author=Mangosing, F. |date=May 25, 2017 |accessdate=May 28, 2017}}</ref> The party said that the "martial law imposition was made on narrow pretext of armed clashes in Marawi City between the AFP and Maute group," which the party referred to as a bandit group whose leaders, the party claim, "have known links with military officials." The CPP also called on Filipinos to fight the imposition of martial law in Mindanao and demand its immediate lifting.<ref name="npa1"/>
Defense Secretary [[Delfin Lorenzana]] warned the New People's Army not to get involved with the [[Marawi crisis]] as he reiterated that the implementation of martial law in Mindanao will not target local communists.<ref name="npa2">{{cite web|url=http://news.mb.com.ph/2017/05/28/dont-mess-with-marawi-city-crisis-lorenzana-warns-npa/ |title=Don’t mess with Marawi City crisis, Lorenzana warns NPA |publisher=[[Manila Bulletin]] |author=Wakefield, F. |date=May 28, 2017 |accessdate=May 28, 2017}}</ref> Lorenzana said that martial law was declared to address [[radical Islamic terrorism]] and [[narco-terrorism]] in Mindanao according to the directives of the President and that they will fully comply with them. He urged the communists not to force the government's hand and to immediately stop all illegal activities and abide by the true spirit of the peace process.<ref name="npa2"/>
Peace talks between the Government of the Philippines and the [[National Democratic Front (Philippines)|National Democratic Front]] in the [[Netherlands]] were suspended following these developments.<ref name="npa3">{{cite web|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/05/27/17/peace-talks-between-government-communists-suspended-anew |title=Peace talks between government, communists suspended anew |publisher=[[ABS-CBN News]] |author=Buenafe, D. |date=May 27, 2017 |accessdate=May 28, 2017}}</ref> It was the second time that it was put on hold since the Duterte administration started negotiations with the communist rebels in 2016, with Presidential Peace Adviser [[Jesus Dureza]] saying the administration "will not proceed to participate in the scheduled fifth round of peace negotiations until such time as there are clear indications that an enabling environment conducive to achieving just and sustainable peace in the land shall prevail." Dureza cited the continuing attacks by the NPA and the communist leadership's order for its armed wing to "accelerate and intensify attacks against the government in the face of martial law in Mindanao."<ref name="npa3"/>
==Allegations of human rights violations== [[Lumad people|Lumads]], or the non-Muslim indigenous peoples of Mindanao, have been vocally against the imposition of martial rule due to the past experience of martial law during the Marcos dictatorship. After 3 months since the imposition of martial rule, numerous human rights violations were recorded by independent human rights organizations{{which|date=December 2017}}.{{citation needed|date=December 2017}} Among these violations caused by the Armed Forces of the Philippines and the Philippine National Police were the bombing of Lumad schools, the food blockade against Lumad communities which forced Lumads to go hungry and move away from their ancestral lands, the capturing of ancestral lands from indigenous Lumads, the killing of suspected Lumads who are reportedly part of the NPA despite no concrete investigation, the censorship of various media outlets in Lumad communities, and the killing of numerous Lumad leaders, which has led to a blow in Lumad morale.{{citation needed|date=December 2017}} Since the declaration of martial law in Mindanao, there was a heightened presence of government security forces which discouraged Lumad children from going to schools.<ref>http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2017/07/25/Duterte-threatens-to-bomb-Lumad-schools.html</ref> Linking Lumad schools to communist rebels, President Rodrigo Duterte in a public speech threatened to bomb the schools which he says are promoting "subversion" and communism ideology.<ref>http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/07/24/17/duterte-threatens-to-bomb-lumad-schools</ref>
Reports also surfaced during and after the [[Battle of Marawi]], stating that six soldiers looted stole jewelries and cash from houses in the city. <ref>http://news.abs-cbn.com/news/10/31/17/soldiers-under-probe-for-alleged-looting-in-marawi</ref>
==See also== * [[Martial law in the Philippines]] * [[Proclamation No. 55]] * [[Proclamation No. 1081]]
